message: Hi Kaila, your eyes are so kind🍀
Thank you Ivo

Hi Kaila, it is softening my soul when I look at you clips. I’m planning to hike, swim and relax in Bali and Lombok somewhere coming half year. How is it to live in Bali for you. Spiritual I feel deeply connected with the buddhist Thich Nhat Hanh a Vietnamese. I visited his temple in Hue last year. It is nice to be connected with a soul like yours🙏🏼 https://youtu.be/alej6887zMM?si=7rFuOj4DjBbTvnbS
True Peace | Teaching by Thich Nhat Hanh | #mindfulness

Hey Ivo, thanks for that compliment. Honestly idk much about Buddhism, our culture here is Hindu, not sure how much in common we have with Buddhism. But that sounds like a lovely plan. Have u been here before?

Hi Kaila, No, I haven’t been to Bali yet — but it’s been calling me for a while now. I’m hoping to finally visit sometime in the coming half year. Just the thought of the nature, the energy, and the culture gives me a peaceful feeling already. And i want to learn Windfoil on the water. I looked it up a bit, and I saw that while Hinduism and Buddhism are different in many ways, there’s actually some overlap — like the focus on inner peace, meditation, karma, and compassion. That connection really fascinates me. I’d love to experience how spirituality is part of daily life in Bali. Do you have favorite places, rituals, or moments that make you feel spiritually grounded there? Do you know about my country Holland?

Hey Ivo, sorry for the late reply. The only thing I know about Holland is that we got colonized by you guys haha. Also I have heard that the situation in Europe is getting worse by the day, is that so? I like that u are into spirituality, its a big part of our culture, we do multiple times a day offerings for our gods to keep us safe

Goodmorning dear Kaila, your messages bring a smile on my face and is never late☺️ oh yeah, sorry for that colonization thing of my grand grand grand parents, they were greedy. Oh Europe is actually quite the same and nice as research shows the people here are most happy about their lives here. I believe holland is #5. Off course not in all cities. It s nice that you have these attention for spiritual habits. Wish you a nice day 🤗

https://www.happierlivesinstitute.org/2025/03/20/the-top-25-happiest-countries-in-2025-plus-our-four-favourite-findings-from-the-2025-world-happiness-report/ The top 25 happiest countries in 2025 plus our 4 favourite findings from the 2025 World Happiness Report - Happier Lives Institute

https://youtu.be/4i5KYDePHDU?si=YjMw6iqKYNJYLd0k
10 Amazing Places to Visit in the Netherlands 4K 🇳🇱 | Netherlands Travel Guide
I will move here in September https://duin.nl/ Nieuwbouw in Almere DUIN: wonen in een uniek duinlandschap
duin.nl
Where do you live in Indonesia?
Haha no worries, already forgiven. Ah okay that's good news then for you, it looks very cool. I live in Dalung. What are u plans for the week?

Hey just finished watching your videos, sounds cool with the new job, hope u will like it and feel a bit more fulfilled with that! Seems that your are in a phase of change generally in your life. How come you are a bit of reinventing your self?
Goodmorning to you Kaila ✨☺️🍀🤗
Can I ask you something Kaila, did you see the clips on my insta? To give an impression of my life? Can I ask about your life, is it correct you are a student in your twenties?
Hi Kaila, can we meet for a dinner when I visit Bali? ☺️

Hey Ivo sorry for the late reply, sometimes I just need a break of social media, so many creepy guys hitting me up in here, it really can drain my energy haha. Yea I checked our your page, I must say you have very beautiful kids! Where is their mom from?

message: haha lets see about that 😃

Hi Kaila, nice to hear from you! Very healthy that you disconnect from social media every now and then. Please protect your energy💆🏻‍♀️ Thank you for checking too. Well my daughter Livia is from a long relationship Dutch woman and Alex, 6 yrs, just wanted to be with us because he came while we were just 3 months dating, taking pil and mother thoughts she could not get pregnant. She is from Suriname with Indonesian roots.

Do you like cooking? I made a vegetarian pizza now and past week with Livia curry with chutney and rice. I am not so good in it, but it s so nice to create something and then try together how tasteful it is☺️
Unsupported message
Use the Instagram mobile app to view this message.
This is our chalet where we live until September when we get the key of our house near the lake.
Sleep well and happy dreams✨

That looks delicious. I would have love to try that pizza. Also the charlet you are staying at the moment looks lovely, so much green and nice weather. I like cooking too, but at the moment I'm more into baking, cookies and cheesecake, but dairy products are compared to other stuff very expensive hehe. How did u spend your sunday and what was your highlight of the Week?

Hi Kaila, so nice that you like cooking too. It is one of the nicest thing as it touches creativity, working with your hands, tasting, making it for each other and trying the result. Ah baking is very nice. Hm cheesecake, well that is something i would like to taste from you after you trying my pizza ☺️👏🏻 Last week was very intense and nice for me. I worked on a business plan for my new business that starts 1st October. This weekend i worked day and night to set up a professional website. With this i can start approaching people. I finished it Sunday. This morning I had a meeting with a company for a tool i need and Tomorrow for the location. Last Tuesday my education. It is going fast now. After this week it is calmer and focussing on buying couch and something to cover windows in the new house. Oh and a bed 😂 As I promised my daughter my old one. How are you feeling? Have a nice day dear Kaila💛
Unsupported message
Use the Instagram mobile app to view this message.

Hi Ivo, Wow, that sounds super exciting and intense, congrats on finishing your website and moving forward so quickly with your business! You’ve really been on fire lately 🔥! I admire how focused and driven you are, also the fact that you still make time for your daughter and even give her your bed, that’s so sweet! 😍 And yes, I totally agree about cooking, it’s one of the most beautiful ways to express love and creativity. Your pizza sounds like a dream! I’d love to try it one day! And deal, I’ll make you my cheesecake in return 😄. I’ve been feeling stressed lately, taking things slowly and enjoying the little moments. What kind of couch are you thinking about getting? Have a lovely day too! Warm hugs from Bali, Kaila 🌺

Hi Kaila I really felt what you said about slowing down and enjoying the little things. Life can be overwhelming sometimes, even with good things happening. I hope you’re giving yourself enough space to breathe and recharge you truly deserve that. This weekend, I did just that: took time to cook something colorful curry with rice, pineapple chutney, and mint garlic yogurt. It was simple but grounding. Cooking really helps me stay present maybe it does that for you too? Oh and I visited the new location it looks so professional! Even better: a key government contact of mine will move into the same building. Great timing for my business and makes things more personal too. Do you want to share what’s on your mind? Warm hugs from here 🍀💛🇳🇱 Ivo
Hi Kaila, if you like we can also talk on whatsapp +31628269575. Have a wonder-full day 🤗🍀
My daughter and I start practicing guitar ☺️

Hi Ivo 😊 Sounds like you’ve had some really special moments lately! That trip to Turkey with your friend and her kids must’ve been lovely, the sea always brings peace 🌊. Looks like so much fun! Was that your girlfriend? You look so happy together. Renovating the floor with a headache? That’s real dedication 😅 And it’s great you had such a good connection with your team Amsterdam must’ve been a fun night out! 🎉 I love that you’re learning guitar with your daughter, that’s such a sweet way to bond. 🎸 What songs are you practicing together? Personally, I played the violin in my childhood. Take care, Kaila 🌼

Hi Kaila ☀️ Thanks for your lovely message. You always write with such warmth, it really brightens my day. Yes, Turkey was beautiful and peaceful. It was also a goodbye, a gentle ending to that chapter with her. Now it’s a sweet memory, part of life’s flow. The floor renovation was actually me helping a friend out. Still a bit of a challenge with that headache 😅 Amsterdam with the team was full of good energy and it felt nice to reconnect. Practicing guitar with my daughter has been a joy. She’s focused, playful and surprisingly quick to pick things up. Violin suits you. I can imagine you playing with calm and presence. Wishing you a gentle day Take care Ivo 🌿

Hi Ivo 🌿 Your messages always bring such calm presence. I’m touched by how thoughtfully you move through life. It’s beautiful that Turkey gave you a peaceful goodbye, those moments shape us quietly. And practicing guitar with your daughter sounds like such a sweet rhythm to share. I can imagine the glow in her eyes when she gets something right 😊 Thank you for what you said about the violin ❤️ I haven’t played much lately… being a student and trying to build something creative on my own has made life full in other ways. Most of my energy now flows into writing, visual storytelling, and just… showing up vulnerably online, even when it’s messy.😜 I recently started a little Patreon, it’s where I share the more honest, quieter parts of myself. 🥰 A space outside the daily noise. Would that be something you’d feel called to support? No pressure, of course, just felt safe to ask you that since I feel like I am slowly getting closer to you. That's why I feel confident to share it with you because I also deeply enjoy sharing stories with you😊. Wishing you and your daughter a beautiful, music-filled day, Kaila ☀️
Reacted to @Ivo's story

Hi Kaila Your message really touched me again there’s something about the way you express yourself that feels sincere and peaceful. I do feel a kind of closeness growing between us, and that means something to me. Thank you for opening up and trusting me with your creative journey. Your Patreon sounds like a beautiful space, and I respect the way you’re showing up vulnerably. At the same time, I also find myself wondering how you see this connection between us. In the past, when I felt this kind of warmth with someone, it sometimes grew into something more real beyond messages. We would talk more directly, share voice notes or even video calls, and get to know more about each other’s daily lives, families, or just small, real things. I’m open to deepening our connection, if that’s something that resonates with you too. Just wanted to be honest about that. Warm thoughts from here 🍀 Ivo
